channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die rails against AI in style
item.description: You've seen this movie before: A disheveled man (Sam Rockwell) busts into a restaurant, threatening to blow up the joint unless a crew of people joins him. Like Groundhog Day, he's been through this countless times before, and he immediately starts recounting otherwise unknowable details to convince the diner patrons. Like 12 Monkeys, he's from the future — the timely twist in Good Luck, Have Fun, Don't Die is that, rather than a world-ending virus, he needs help preventing a humanity-ending AI from being born. Good Luck is more of a primal scream than a thoughtful articulation about where eve...

item.title: Amazon’s Ring cancels partnership with Flock, a network of AI cameras used by ICE, feds, and police
item.description: This news comes less than a week after Ring's Super Bowl commercial stoked controversy over the company's capacity for mass surveillance.

item.title: Fin de la 2G : Free Mobile pousse ses abonnés à changer de téléphone
item.description: Free Mobile a commencé à prévenir ses clients toujours en 2G qu'il va falloir migrer rapidement vers des réseaux plus modernes. En toile de fond : la fermeture définitive de la 2G d'Orange.

item.title: Forget Valentine's Day — BBC has just dropped first look at the deranged romantic crime drama I'm most excited for this year
item.description: The best romance dramas aren't releasing this Valentine's Day — my most-anticipated BBC iPlayer show of the year just got its first look, and it's outright disturbing.

item.title: I tried Nintendo’s free Hello Mario app — and I can’t believe how fun it is (yes, it’s for kids)
item.description: Nintendo built a new, free Hello Mario app; we got a chance to try it and now can't wait to try it again.

item.title: Move over, Apple and Samsung – this Huawei smartwatch has a world-first diabetes feature, but there’s a catch
item.description: The Huawei Watch GT 6 Pro smartwatch can now measure your blood sugar levels in a non-invasive way thanks to a new update.

item.title: Meta’s Quest 3S is $50 off, and includes Batman: Arkham Shadow for free
item.description: Meta’s VR strategy is in a bit of an uncertain place right now, with the company recently cutting many jobs at its Reality Labs, and discontinuing new content drops in beloved experiences like Supernatural. Even so, there’s still a lot of fun to be had with its Meta Quest 3S if you’ve been curious about […]

item.title: Pick up this Samsung microSD Express card while it's on sale for $40 off
item.description: If you're looking to expand the storage on your Switch 2, the 512GB Samsung P9 microSD Express card is on sale right now for 33 percent off, marked down to $80 from $120. With component prices skyrocketing these days, it's getting increasingly rare to see good storage on sale, and 512GB for $80 is a much better deal than you'll currently find directly from Nintendo. The P9 boasts transfer speeds of up to 800MB/s, making moving games to the card that much faster. As for load times, in our testing we found that any microSD Express, the standard the Switch 2 requires, will offer roughly the same ...

item.title: La récente manette 8BitDo Pro 3, dont les boutons sont interchangeables, chute sous les 50 € grâce à ce code promo
item.description: Si vous cherchez une nouvelle manette Bluetooth astucieusement conçue pour jouer sur PC, smartphone ou Switch, alors la 8BitDo Pro 3 devrait vous convenir. Elle est actuellement disponible à un excellent prix sur AliExpress : 47,39 euros au lieu de 69,99 euros.

item.title: Ce radar vélo boosté à l’IA cartographique les portions les plus dangereuses de vos trajets
item.description: Prévu pour cet été 2026, le radar vélo Luna Oculus dispose d’une caméra qui détecte les véhicules à l’approche, sert de rétroviseur arrière, et montre les points critiques sur vos trajets.

item.title: Cette mise à jour de Windows 11 peut vous enfermer dans une boucle de redémarrages sans fin
item.description: Nouvelle mise à jour de Windows 11, nouveau bug critique.

item.title: ICE moves out to the suburbs
item.description: We sat in a parking lot and waited. We watched, knowing we were being watched in return. Two men, masked and presumably armed, idled in a gray SUV. "They're all on this fucking street now," Lety, a lifelong resident of the Minnesota suburbs, told me. ICE had been spotted at a gas station and a […]

item.title: The DJI Pocket 3 finally has a new rival – meet the Insta360 Luna, the world’s first compact dual-lens vlogging camera
item.description: Insta360 has officially unveiled its first pocket gimbal camera, and the CEO is making it clear this isn't just a DJI Osmo Pocket rip-off.

item.title: Meta reportedly wants to add face recognition to smart glasses while privacy advocates are distracted
item.description: Meta aims to introduce facial recognition to its smart glasses while its biggest critics are distracted, according to a report from The New York Times. In an internal document reviewed by The Times, Meta says it will launch the feature "during a dynamic political environment where many civil society groups that we would expect to […]

item.title: Comment utiliser un Samsung Galaxy SmartTag sur n’importe quel smartphone Android
item.description: Vous ne possédez pas de smartphone Samsung mais souhaitez acheter les SmartTag ? Bonne nouvelle : un développeur ingénieux a fait sauter le verrou écosystémique imposé par le constructeur coréen. Grâce à une application open source, ces traceurs Bluetooth fonctionnent désormais avec n'importe quel smartphone Android.

item.title: WP Engine-Automattic feud resurfaces with new claims of royalty fees and contract threats
item.description: WP Engine just updated its legal claim against Automattic, but CEO Matt Mullenweg isn't concerned.

item.title: Cohere’s $240M year sets stage for IPO
item.description: Cohere surpassed $240 million in annual recurring revenue in 2025, highlighting strong enterprise AI demand as the Canadian startup positions itself for a potential IPO amid intensifying competition from OpenAI and Anthropic.

item.title: How AI-powered threats are rewriting email security economics
item.description: AI-driven false positives drain SOC capacity while attackers exploit noise and outdated security architectures.

item.title: Microsoft fait retirer un jeu de Steam par erreur à cause de l’IA
item.description: Un robot de protection de droits d’auteur de Microsoft a confondu un titre indépendant avec Minecraft, entraînant la suppression momentanée du jeu du catalogue Steam.

item.title: ‘Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles’ and ‘G.I. Joe’ Are Combining Into the Action Figures of Your ’80s Fever Dreams (Exclusive)
item.description: Never afraid to shy away from a crossover, the TMNT are mashing up another group of real American heroes.

item.description: Looking for NYT Connections answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, plus my commentary on the puzzles.

item.description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

item.title: Meta plans to add facial recognition to its smart glasses, report claims
item.description: The feature, internally known as “Name Tag,” would allow smart glasses wearers to identify people and get information about them via Meta's AI assistant.

item.title: The latest 45W Anker Nano charger with smart display is $10 off right now
item.description: Anker introduced a nifty little charger at CES 2026, which is a refresh of the pre-existing Nano Charger. It's already on sale for $30, which is a discount of $10 or 25 percent. The 45W charger includes a smart display that shows real-time data like power flow, temperature and charging status. It also features "fun animations to keep things cheerful." Anker says it can recognize what's being charged and automatically adjust certain metrics to ensure a longer battery lifespan. To that end, it works with just about everything. The company advertises that this charger is a good fit for the iPhon...

item.title: Presidents' Day sales 2026: The best tech deals to shop this week from Apple, Sony, Samsung and others
item.description: You can find a lot of good deals for Presidents’ Day, but to say it’s a tech-deal boon would be an overstatement. The best Presidents’ Day deals are usually on mattresses, appliances and furniture, but you can find some decent tech sales thrown in as well. This year, Presidents’ Day comes right after Valentine’s Day and Super Bowl 2026, which means there are even more chances to save as sales and discounts overlap. If you’re looking for a new streaming device, a fresh iPad or an upgraded vacuum so you can enter the spring-cleaning season properly, we have you covered. These are the best Presid...

item.title: Meta is reportedly working to bring facial recognition to its smart glasses
item.description: Meta has backed away from highly controversial facial recognition tech in its products and services before, but seemingly not so far that it isn’t willing to have another crack at it. A new report from The New York Times claims Mark Zuckerberg’s company wants to add facial recognition to its lineup of branded smart glasses at some point this year. The NYT spoke to four anonymous people with knowledge of Meta’s plans, who told the publication that the feature is codenamed "Name Tag" internally. As you’d expect, it would let people wearing Meta-powered Oakley or Ray-Ban glasses identify people a...

item.title: Is this the world’s best smart-phone camera?
item.description: A partnership with Leica leads to a highly advanced camera that’s also fun to shoot. Leica is perhaps the most storied brand in photography. A portmanteau formed from the name of founder Ernst Leitz and the word “camera”, the first Leica popularized 35mm photography, while the legendary M system standardized the modern rangefinder in 1954 and has a hallowed reputation to this day. ...

item.title: On a vu le smartphone Samsung ultra rare spécialement conçu pour les JO d’hiver
item.description: Voici à quoi ressemble le Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 Olympic Edition spécialement conçu pour les JO d'hiver.

item.title: Listeria fears hit BJ’s Wholesale Club in several states. Avoid this recalled frozen salmon product
item.description: Food contamination by the bacteria could turn serious and even deadly. The FDA says no illnesses have been reported so far. Here’s what to know. A Massachusetts-based seafood importer and distributor has recalled salmon that was sold across multiple states due to concerns that the product may be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, a potentially deadly bacteria. ...

item.title: There’s a tiny digital camera inside these retro 35mm film rolls
item.description: Following the popularity of the Kodak Charmera, it was inevitable that other retro-inspired digital toy cameras would start popping up. While the Charmera's design was inspired by the '80s single-use Kodak Fling camera, the OPT100 Neo Film crams a basic digital camera into a 35mm film roll that comes inside a plastic canister and a […]

item.title: De 100 Go à 100 Mo : Sony a une idée pour faire chuter drastiquement le poids des jeux
item.description: Sony réfléchit à un système qui réduirait drastiquement la taille des jeux à télécharger sur sa console.

item.title: Apple's first-gen AirTags are on sale for $64 for a four-pack
item.description:
At this point, you can find discounts on AirTags fairly often but if you want to spend as little as possible, it's worth waiting for a discount like this. A four-pack of the first-gen Bluetooth trackers is on sale for $64, which is just about a record-low price (only $1 more). That's a 35 percent discount on the pack. Bear in mind that this deal brings the price per AirTag down to about $16 if you were to buy them individually, and when not on sale they usually cost $29.
If you use Apple devices and consider yourself to be a serial thing-misplacer, AirTags are extremely useful. Adding one t...

item.title: La Russie restreint Telegram et coupe WhatsApp
item.description: Les utilisateurs russes de Telegram et de WhatsApp risquent très bientôt de ne plus avoir d'autre choix que de basculer vers la messagerie officielle du Kremlin, ou de passer par un VPN pour continuer à discuter avec leurs apps de prédilection.

item.title: Apple Presidents' Day sales: Get the Apple Watch Series 11 for $299, plus more deals
item.description: Whether you're one of the few people still keeping up with New Year's resolutions or just want an upgraded smartwatch, now is a good time to get an Apple Watch. Currently, the Apple Watch Series 11 is on sale for $299 for Presidents' Day, down from $399. The 25 percent discount brings the 2025 model back down to its record-low price. A number of other Apple devices are on sale for the holiday as well. We named the Apple Watch Series 11 as our choice for best smartwatch overall. It scored a 90 in our review thanks to its 24 hours-plus of battery life and a thin, light design that's easy to wear...

item.title: Smartphones, trottinettes, vélos : qu’est-ce que l’emballement thermique, ce phénomène qui transforme les batteries en chalumeau
item.description: Au cœur de notre quotidien, les batteries stockent de l’énergie qui, parfois, peut être libérée de manière incontrôlée. Dans certaines situations, cela peut provoquer un incendie grave, voire une explosion. Et si certaines causes sont techniques, beaucoup de risques découlent aussi des comportements des utilisateurs.

item.title: Ce picoprojecteur ultradesign qui peut projeter des images sur le plafond ou sur le sol coûte moins de 170 € grâce à cette offre
item.description: Design cubique très affirmé, support pivotant à 230°, images en Full HD jusqu'à 130 pouces... Le Wanbo Cube 2 Pro ne manque certainement pas d'atouts. En plus, il n'est même pas hors de prix : Amazon l'affiche à 169,99 euros au lieu de 249,99 euros.

item.title: En images : les moments les plus forts du lancement de Sophie Adenot vers l’espace
item.description: Après des mois de préparation et d’entraînement intensif, Sophie Adenot a finalement pris son envol à bord de Crew-12 pour rejoindre l’orbite terrestre. Un moment marquant qui s’est déroulé sans encombre, et sur lequel Futura vous propose de revenir en images.

item.title: Best Buy goes big for its Presidents' Day sale — I've found the 50 top deals from $25.99
item.description: I've searched through the Best Buy Presidents' Day sale and rounded up 50 of the best deals this weekend on TVs, appliances, laptops, and more top-rated tech.

item.title: Fiat Topolino : la petite voiture électrique sans permis évolue, mais le fait payer
item.description: La Fiat Topolino, petite voiture électrique sans permis de la marque, évolue sur plusieurs points : elle gagne une couleur supplémentaire, un écran LCD couleur... et coûte un peu plus cher, flirtant désormais avec les 10 000 euros.

item.title: Intelligence artificielle | Hollywood accuse le logiciel chinois Seedance 2.0 de violations « massives » du droit d’auteur
item.description: L’association des grands studios hollywoodiens accuse dans un communiqué le logiciel chinois Seedance 2.0, lancé par ByteDance, de violations « massives » du droit d’auteur, après la diffusion d’une vidéo virale générée par l’IA montrant un combat entre Tom Cruise et Brad Pitt.

item.title: 'If someone can inject instructions or spurious facts into your AI’s memory, they gain persistent influence over your future interactions': Microsoft warns AI recommendations are being "poisoned" to serve up malicious results
item.description: AI Recommendation Poisoning is real and already out there, Microsoft warns.

item.title: Pinterest stock is falling off a cliff for a surprising reason: Here’s what’s driving the PINS collapse today
item.description: The image-sharing platform blamed its lower-than-expected financial results on tariffs. It makes more sense when you read between the lines. Investors in Pinterest (NYSE: PINS) are waking up to a wall of red this morning. The stock price of the popular digital image-sharing board has fallen off a cliff after the company reported its Q4 2025 results yesterday. Here’s what you need to know....

item.title: The Russo Brothers Say Steve Rogers Is Key to ‘Avengers: Doomsday’
item.description: Plus, Liam Neeson is uncommitted about his potential return to 'Darkman'.

item.title: Score, the dating app for people with good credit, is back
item.description: Two years ago, a controversial dating app was launched and quickly shuttered: for people with good-to-excellent credit. Now, the founder is relaunching it, open to anyone.

item.title: Windows 11 could finally get one of the most-requested features from Windows 10, as Microsoft gets serious about winning over the haters
item.description: How serious is Microsoft about repairing the damaged reputation of Windows 11? Serious enough to bring back moving the taskbar.

item.title: What is the release date for A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms episode 5 on HBO Max?
item.description: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms' second-to-last chapter will air very soon – here's when it'll drop where you live.

item.title: 'She's had enough and is starting to take her power back': Under Salt Marsh episode 4 changes one storyline for good — and the cast are all for it
item.description: We're over halfway through Under Salt Marsh now episode 4 is streaming on Sky TV, and one character is set on 'taking her power back'.

item.title: The ridiculously tiny Kodak Charmera captured our hearts (and lots of shoddy pictures)
item.description: Every once in a while, a product comes along that sparks a bit of joy in our jaded hearts. This is what happened with the Kodak Charmera, a $30 tiny toy camera that was nearly impossible to get ahold of in the first couple of months after its release, selling out immediately over waves of blind box restocks. Despite the gimmick of it all, the Charmera was just too cute for some of us to resist, and we sprang when they finally started becoming more readily available. A few of us on the Engadget team have one now, and even with all of its shortcomings, we kind of love this thing. Here's what tw...

item.title: Match Group CEO: Public performance reviews build ‘a culture of transparency’
item.description: ‘Transparency only works if it goes both ways. You can’t expect people to speak up if you don’t show them it makes a difference.’ Since Spencer Rascoff took over as Match Group CEO in early 2025, he has set about trying to revive its portfolio of dating apps, in part by winning back user trust and courting Gen Z. “Trust is the foundation of real connections, and we are committed to rebuilding it with urgency, accountability, and an unwavering focus on the user,” Rascoff said last March in a letter to employees sharing his vision. ...

item.title: Oubliez la Surface Pro : le futur PC hybride de Lenovo corrige le pire défaut de ce format
item.description: Deux ans après la sortie du X12 Gen 2, Lenovo s'apprête à ressusciter son format tablette hybride pour les pros. Plus fin, avec des bordures réduites et un clavier revu pour corriger l'un des plus gros défauts du format, le ThinkPad X13 Detachable a tout pour faire de l'ombre à la Surface Pro de Microsoft.

item.title: This top lawyer at Goldman Sachs just resigned, as close ties with Jeffrey Epstein emerge
item.description: Emails between Kathy Ruemmler and Jeffrey Epstein revealed she described the sex offender as an ‘older brother.’ Kathy Ruemmler, the top lawyer at storied investment bank Goldman Sachs and former White House counsel to President Barack Obama, announced her resignation Thursday, after emails between her and Jeffrey Epstein showed a close relationship where she described him as an “older brother” and downplayed his sex crimes.Ruemmler said in a statement that she would “step down as Chief Legal Officer and General Counsel of Goldman Sachs as of June 30, 2026.”Up until her resignation, Ruemmler r...

item.title: Stuff Your Kindle Day is live — get 100s of free dark romance books this weekend
item.description: The latest Stuff Your Kindle Day is live. Download free dark romance books for your Kindle on Dark Romance Day.

item.title: What to do when your colleague keeps making excuses
item.description: Take these five simple steps to solve the problem constructively. If you are dealing with an employee or colleague who consistently underperforms and makes excuses, it can be extremely frustrating. When someone underperforms it not only slows down team progress and lowers the quality of work, but also forces others to take on extra tasks. This increases the workload for the rest of the team, which often means more stress and potential burnout for those left picking up the load....
